Subjective: Fatigue for 2 months; superficial sleep; muscle pain, back pain; morning stiffness. No clear acute onset. No respiratory problems, allergies under control; no heart issues, palpitations, or chest pain; normal appetite, weight stable; normal stools and urination; no snoring or sleep apnea symptoms. Able to work and exercise (climbing, cycling) but tired at end of day; resting on weekends. Concern: Is there something wrong with my body? Possibly rheumatism.
Objective: BP 110/60, HR 40-60. Lungs clear. Back: mild tenderness near center; no pain with pelvic pressure; no abnormalities in neck/shoulders. Abdomen: lively peristalsis, varying sounds, supple, no pain.
Assessment: Fatigue, cause unclear. Possible differential diagnoses: anemia, thyroid disorder, rheumatoid arthritis. No clear signs of rheumatoid arthritis based on symptoms and physical exam.
Plan: 1. Blood tests: CBC (for anemia), TSH (thyroid function), ESR/CRP (inflammation). 2. Patient to schedule blood draw at Atal Medial. 3. Follow-up phone appointment to discuss results and next steps.
